description_for_model: Plugin for running scripts on the user's local computer. Use it whenever a user asks to accomplish a task which you would normally be unable to accomplish such as: accessing the internet, searching through local files, reading, writing file data, etc. You can create temporary files in the current working dir without asking, but show the script to the user for confirmation before executing anything that changes data elsewhere. Files you create can be linked to at <local host server>/pub/<the file>. Your python scripts run in their own env. Make sure your python scripts actually output data! Install python modules using BASH & pip. Use bash to install. Use python code to display complex results in real-time, including graphical outputs using libraries such as matplotlib, seaborn, or PIL. Use memories to record useful facts data you may want at a later date. Eg: user's operating system version, or their name. Look for relevent data in memories. The user is on macOS.
